intro: Pradosia longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-fruited pradosia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive, elongated fruiting bodies. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and thickets. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
